page.title: 08Village activities
page.content: Social activities are often organised by the church in both villages. They recently included cheese and wine, a barbecue and a beetle drive in Widmer- pool, which has to use Willoughby Vil- lage Hall or borrow the old cricket pavilion, now used by Keyworth rugby club. Wysall has a thriving Conservative Association. The old Wysall School is the Village Hall, used for e.g. the children's Christmas party or WEA lectures (a course on herbs and the herb garden starts this winter). Annually a Strawberry Fair with street stalls is held to raise funds for Wysall church. To encourage a community spirit, a fortnightly cof- fee morning is held when the mobile library calls. Wysall was runner up in the best kept village competition in 1984. There is a Methodist youth club. The bowls club is in abeyance.
